item.title: Question about not having a item?
item.dc:creator: @sickedank sickedank
item.description:
@sickedank wrote:

else if ((objectID == 1528) && (objectX == 3259) && (objectY == 3390)) { if (playerHasItem(2945)) { teleportToX = 3259; teleportToY = 3391; } else { sendMessage("You need a red key to go down these stairs"); break; } }

[code]else if(useItemID == 3741 && atObjectID == 2457)//jadtele
{
deleteItem(3741, getItemSlot(3741), 1);
teleportToX = 2911;
teleportToY = 3614;
sendMessage(“Welcome to the Jad Mini Game!”);
}

else if ((objectID == 1528) && (objectX == 3259) && (objectY == 3390)) {
if (playerHasItem(2945)) {
teleportToX = 3259;
teleportToY = 3391;
} else {
sendMessage(“You need a red key to go down these stairs”);
break;
}
}
if (useItemID == 293 && (atObjectX == 3268 && atObjectY == 3435)) { // black drAGON CAVE
teleportToX = 3255;
teleportToY = 9581;
sendMessage(“No turning back now”);
}[/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 09, 2008, 05:14:37 PM[/size][hr]The problem was you were either using too many "}"s, or you forgot a “}”

item.title: Question about not having a item?
item.dc:creator: @runevault runevault
item.description:
@runevault wrote:

i found one already built in to my source similar to yours…

case 1733: if (objectX == 2603 && objectY == 3078 && playerEquipment[playerHands] == 776) { teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = (absY + 6397); } else if (objectX == 2603 && objectY == 3078) { sendMessage( "You need to be wielding goldsmith gaunlets to use these stairs."); } else { teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = (absY + 6397); } break;

but the problem is, when i click stairs nothing happens, how do i make it teleport you to the coordinates i want?

Read full topic

item.title: Question about not having a item?
item.dc:creator: @Lagex Lagex
item.description:
@Lagex wrote:

I’m using devolution.
A very simple source if you know what simple really is.
Objects are simple.
All you need to know is standard Java.
Please learn it. Once you do that, then come back.
It’s simple, and if you don’t understand, I cannot further help you.
This is easy, and my 10 year old brother understands it…

} else if (objectID == 1740) { stairs = 2; skillX = objectX; skillY = objectY; stairDistance = 1; } else if (objectID == 1723) { stairs = 22; skillX = objectX; skillY = objectY; stairDistance = 2; stairDistanceAdd = 2; } else if ((objectID == 1733) && (objectX == 2603) && (objectY == 3078)) { if (playerHasItem(1543)) { teleportToX = 2717; teleportToY = 9802; } else { sendMessage("You need a red key to go down these stairs"); break; }

item.source: Question about not having a item?

item.title: Question about not having a item?
item.dc:creator: @Lagex Lagex
item.description:
@Lagex wrote:

[quote=“runevault, post:7, topic:197742”]What do i put for

(objectX == ####) && (objectY == ####)) {[/quote]
If you have Mopar or use that Client, then if you right click the object…
You’ll see (####) (####,####)
The first parenthesis is the object id.
The second on is coordinates.
As in: (6923) (3222,3222)
So, when you get the coordinates, the first one is always X, so…
(objectX == 3222)
The second one is always Y, so…
(objectY == 3222)

I hope this helps you.

Read full topic
